channel.title: Port Scanning on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Port Scanning on TLDRBins

item.title: Network Discovery
item.description: Test Connectivity Linux Windows # Default ping indefinitely ping -c3 <TARGET> # Default traceroute <TARGET> # ICMP echo request traceroute -I <TARGET> # TCP traceroute -T <TARGET> # UDP (filter evasion) traceroute -U <TARGET> # Set src port (filter evasion) traceroute --sport=<SRC_PORT> <TARGET> # Set dest port (filter evasion) traceroute -p <DEST_PORT> <TARGET> # Default 5 pings ping <TARGET> # Default tracert <TARGET> # Check specific port Test-NetConnection <TARGET> -Port <TARGET_PORT> # With Active Directory Module Installed Get-ADComputer -Filter * | ForEach-Object { $_ | Select-Object Name, @{Name='IPAddress';Expression={(Test-Connection -ComputerName $_.

item.title: Nmap
item.description: Host Discovery Ping Scan nmap -sn <TARGET> $ nmap -sn 192.168.100.1 Starting Nmap 7.95 ( https://nmap.org ) at 2025-07-17 11:25 UTC Nmap scan report for 192.168.100.1 Host is up (0.41s latency). Nmap done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 1.35 seconds Scan Techniques (Bypass Network Filtering) TCP SYN to Listed Ports nmap -sn -PS<PORT_LIST> <TARGET> $ nmap -sn -PS53,80,443 192.168.100.1 Starting Nmap 7.95 ( https://nmap.org ) at 2025-07-17 11:25 UTC Nmap scan report for 192.

item.title: Squid Proxy
item.description: Config location /etc/squid/squid.conf Connect via FoxyProxy Firefox plugin +--------------------------+ | Settings | +--------------------------+ | Title : squid proxy | | Proxy Type : HTTP | | Proxy IP : <TARGET> | | Port : 3128 | | Username : (If any) | | Password : (If any) | +--------------------------+ # Connect http://<TARGET> # Or http://127.0.0.1 Internal ports scan via proxy # 1. Take note of word size, then Ctrl+C wfuzz -z range,1-1000 -p <TARGET>:3128:HTTP -u http://127.
